system.description: As precise and accurate as a well-crafted arrow, archers don't mess around. They prefer to keep their distance, as that is where they are the most effective, never letting anyone get too close to them. Archers are direct and focused and thus make the best guards. Ever vigilant, archers are always looking ahead as, if taken by surprise, they are easily killed. If you are playing an Archer be direct, and on target, sturdy and perhaps high strung, watchful of the future and of your back.

results.hit: Target takes a @L[Damage:Hack]{vitals hack} of your choice.
results.critHit: If you want, target takes @L[Core:Damage]{standard damage} as well.

overview.base: You turn an arrow into a @L[Category:Conjured spells]{conjured} @L[Category:Ray delivery spells]{ray spell} of your choice and may cast it as your next @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack}. If you choose to make it @L[Keyword:UB]{UB} using @L[Ability:Energy Blast Arrow]{Energy Blast Arrow}, you may turn it into a @L[Category:Conjured spells]{conjured} @L[Category:Ball delivery spells]{ball spell} instead. You are not @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{proficient} with this @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attack} and cannot @L[Core:Heightening]{heighten} it.
overview.proficient: You are now @L[Core:Proficiency Bonus]{proficient} with the @L[Category:Spells]{spells} you arrows turn into. You still cannot @L[Core:Heightening]{heighten} them.
overview.fluent: You are now @L[Core:Fluency Bonus]{fluent} with the @L[Category:Spells]{spells} you arrows turn into.

results.save: The @L[Core:Interactions]{attack's} effect @L[Core:Fizzles]{fizzles} and the @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attacker} is @L[Condition:Snared]{snared}.

system.endCondition: At the end of each of the target's @L[Core:Turn]{turns}, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.
system.requirements: You block with a @L[Category:Bows]{bow} or your hand.

overview.base: The extra @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attacks} you make with @L[Ability:Multi-Shot]{Multi-Shot} all count as a single @L[Core:Attack Interaction]{attack} for the purpose of @L[Core:Attack Penalty]{attack penalties}.

You are an @L[Keyword:Expertise]{expert} @L[Tradecraft:Hunter]{hunter}. In addition, you have @L[Keyword:Adept]{adept} @L[Ability:Slay]{Slay} for one species of your choice. You can change the species once per a @L[Core:Short Rest]{short rest}.
Any @L[Keyword:Warded]{warded} @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attacks} you make with @L[Category:Bows]{bows} or arrows are @L[Keyword:Boosted]{boosted}.

Target takes an additional [[/damage 5[lethal]]] @L[Core:Damage]{damage}. This also has all @L[Category:Damage types]{damage types} of the triggering @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attack}. If the triggering @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attack} was a critical hit, this deals 10 @L[Core:Damage]{damage} instead.

system.trigger: You have just hit a creature with an @L[Category:Attack abilities]{attack} that dealt them @L[Core:Damage]{damage} from it.
system.limitation: Only usable against one species, as specified when you use Gamesman.
